snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who is approved of by 68 percent of New York voters, outlined a plan for 2012 that was more pragmatic than visionary.
abstract: News analysis; New York Gov. Andrew M Cuomo is aware that his 68 percent approval rate among state's voters will not last forever; Cuomo outlines a plan for 2012 in his State of the State address that is more pragmatic than visionary.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who is approved of by 68 percent of New York voters, outlined a plan for 2012 that was more pragmatic than visionary.

headline.seo: For Cuomo, Hoping to Maintain First-Year Momentum
headline.main: Productive and Popular, but Facing a Challenge in Remaining So
headline.print_headline: Productive and Popular, but Facing a Challenge in Remaining So
